channel.title: [NEED HELP WITH SERVER] Cant get on it on other pc
channel.description:
Hey man im trying to make a sever
https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,654425.0.html
I did manage to get on it on my own pc but not on my other :/
Can anny1 help plz, another server will also be okay, just a nice one i geuss..
Plz add my skype: ImNo T Satan
THX!!!!

item.title: [NEED HELP WITH SERVER] Cant get on it on other pc
item.dc:creator: @ImlNotSatan ImlNotSatan
item.description:
@ImlNotSatan wrote:

[quote=“The Web Guy, post:3, topic:546838”][quote author=PseudoCode link=topic=665736.msg4450688#msg4450688 date=1411137604]
You probably logged in as “127.0.0.1” on the hosting machine. Other computers need the ip. Also make sure you’ve port forwarded.
[/quote]

This is mostly true.

Here are some steps to try and fix this…

  1. From the computer that the server is hosted on, go to run > type in cmd > type in ipconfig
  2. Take note of your IPv4 address it should be 192.168.1.X.
  3. If you only plan to play the server within your local network, then you don’t need to port-forward, other computer on your local network can connect to your sever using your local IPv4 address.
  4. The IP that the client connects to can be changed in the client files, usually in client.java/gui.java/jframe.java, check those files for 127.0.0.1.

If nothing above works, you probably didn’t follow the steps correctly, in that case, try again. If you still can’t get it, let me know what you’re being stuck on.[/quote]
I already did that, could you add my skype please?

ImNo T Satan

Read full topic
item.source: [NEED HELP WITH SERVER] Cant get on it on other pc

item.title: [NEED HELP WITH SERVER] Cant get on it on other pc
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

PseudoCode:

You probably logged in as “127.0.0.1” on the hosting machine. Other computers need the ip. Also make sure you’ve port forwarded.

This is mostly true.

Here are some steps to try and fix this…

  1. From the computer that the server is hosted on, go to run > type in cmd > type in ipconfig
  2. Take note of your IPv4 address it should be 192.168.1.X.
  3. If you only plan to play the server within your local network, then you don’t need to port-forward, other computer on your local network can connect to your sever using your local IPv4 address.
  4. The IP that the client connects to can be changed in the client files, usually in client.java/gui.java/jframe.java, check those files for 127.0.0.1.

If nothing above works, you probably didn’t follow the steps correctly, in that case, try again. If you still can’t get it, let me know what you’re being stuck on.

Read full topic
